	CREDITS

	"Frauds" features guest appearances by Mattias Olsson, Henric Larsson, 
	Christian Fernandes, GÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¶sta FrÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¥d and Gryqllo.

	Cover art and design by Azin Ashourvan - http://azin.se


	INFO

	Following his debut album "Guidelines For An Emerging Century" in 2007, 
	Stockholm based producer Mr.Suitcase spent autumn recording new songs and
	doing remixes. In December, he began putting together what he had planned
	to be a mixtape for his friends. A simple task, it seemed, but he failed.

	Instead of just mixing songs in a set, he found himself	weaving all the 
	tracks together, inspired by the collage aesthetics of band such as 
	The Avalanches and Saint Etienne. He began adding new elements where he 
	thought the originals were lacking. People began dropping by the studio 
	to record vocals and instruments over the loops and fragments he&#039;d 
	extracted from the original tunes. Soon enough, the result had become 
	something very different than just a generic mixtape.

	"Frauds" is neither mixtape nor album. It&#039;s neither remix or mash-up. 
	It&#039;s something in between it all, with a touch of ambient atmosphere 
	added. "Frauds" is built from elements ranging from Prince to The Rice 
	Twins, from Nicolas Makelberge to Bryan Ferry, from Usher to Viktor 
	SjÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¶berg, layered with field recordings and finalized in the late night 
	sessions in Roth HÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¤ndle Studio where the album... Sorry, the fraud was 
	completed.
